text: Psalm 47
God Is King over All the Earth

For the \add music\add* director. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.\f + \fr Ps 47 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
All \add you\add* peoples, clap \add your\add* hands.\f + \fr 47:1 \ft Hebrew “hand” \f*
Shout to God with a voice of rejoicing.
For Yahweh Most High \add is\add* awesome,\f + \fr 47:2 \ft Or “to be feared” \f*
a great king over all the earth.
He subdues peoples under us
and nations under our feet.
He chooses for us our inheritance,
the pride of Jacob whom he loves.
God has gone up with a shout,
Yahweh with \add the\add* sound of a trumpet.
Sing praises \add to\add* God, sing praises.
Sing praises to our king, sing praises.
For God \add is\add* king of all the earth.
Sing praises with understanding.\f + \fr 47:7 \ft Or “sing a maskil” \f*
God reigns over nations;
God sits on his holy throne.
\add The\add* princes of \add the\add* peoples are gathered together
\add with\add* the people of Abraham’s God.
For \add the\add* shields of \add the\add* earth belong to God.
He is very exalted.
